headline: Erik ten Hag's plan for when Man Utd team is fully fit is bad news for summer signing
body: Leny Yoro became Manchester United's most expensive signing of the summer after joining from Lille, but the teenage centre-back faces a battle to feature under Erik ten Hag
New Manchester United signing Leny Yoro may struggle to find his place in Erik ten Hag's defence even when he's back at full fitness.

The player's prospects look limited in the short term, even though United shelled out an initial £52million to pip Real Madrid to his signature. Yoro suffered a foot injury during a pre-season match against Arsenal and isn't expected to return to play until after the November international break.

But even when fit, the 18-year-old's chances of starting don't look promising due to the arrival of Matthijs de Ligt, a more experienced central defender who has previously worked with Ten Hag. Despite Yoro's hefty price tag, the player was always seen as a long-term investment due to his youth, and he may not get the playing time he desires at Old Trafford shortly.

The Athletic claims Ten Hag is likely to pair De Ligt with Lisandro Martinez on the right and left sides of central defence, respectively, if he has a fully fit squad. De Ligt, 25, was seemingly brought in as an upgrade on Harry Maguire, who has often been used as the aerial threat in defence to compensate for Martinez's lack of height.

The Dutchman is still settling in at United and only played around 10 minutes off the bench in his Premier League debut during the recent 1-0 victory over Fulham. Ten Hag ended that match with three central defenders on the pitch after Jonny Evans also came on, suggesting there could be more flexibility in defence going forward.

When it comes to Yoro's prospects in the starting XI, it's worth noting the talent - born in 2005 - will likely need considerable time to adjust to the demands of the Premier League. The English top flight is notoriously challenging for young foreign players, and even Yoro's hefty transfer fee doesn't guarantee he'll rise to the occasion.

This raises questions about whether United - fresh off their worst-ever Premier League finish of eighth - might have been better off investing that money elsewhere. The club is currently negotiating to sign midfielder Manuel Ugarte from Paris Saint-Germain, while a top-tier striker is also believed to be on the wish list after Rasmus Hojlund's struggles as the primary forward last season.

With Hojlund currently out of action, attacking midfielder Bruno Fernandes was deployed as the team's leading man against the Cottagers. Ten Hag previously experimented with his captain in a forward role during pre-season, but the results have been less than stellar.

Yoro brings valuable experience from Lille having made his senior debut at 16 and clocked up 60 first-team appearances for Les Dogues. However, the weight of his price tag and the task of reviving the hopes of the United fanbase presents a new challenge - and no meagre one at that.

For now, his injury means any queries about his absence from the starting lineup will be paused. However, there's a possibility both he and the club may question if his potential is being underutilised if he doesn't feature in Ten Hag's starting plans soon.

headline: Bruno Fernandes shows his true colours with gesture to outgoing Man Utd star
body: Manchester United sold Facundo Pellistri to Panathinaikos to continue a busy transfer and Bruno Fernandes sent a message to the Uruguay international on his departure
Bruno Fernandes has delivered a touching tribute to departing Manchester United winger Facundo Pellistri on social media.

The 22-year-old ended his four-year association with United on Wednesday by completing a permanent transfer to Panathinaikos. Pellistri made 13 appearances for the Red Devils in the Premier League and also spent time on loan at Alaves and Granada.

United have included have included a 45 percent sell-on clause in the deal for the Uruguay international, who they signed from Penarol for £7.65million. The club have also negotiated a three-year buy-back clause after the player signed a four-year deal with the Greek outfit.

Pellistri was afforded little time on the pitch Old Trafford but clearly left an impression on Manchester United captain Fernandes, who praised his ex-teammate's attitude and predicted a successful career in a classy post on Instagram.

Fernandes' message read: " Hermanito was a pleasure to meet you and play alongside you.If is there someone that deserves everything good in a football career is you ! An example of professionalism and humility.Big things are coming to you soon I’m pretty sure."

That saw Pellistri return the compliment to Fernandes, who recently extended his contract at United until 2027. The Panathinaikos new boy highlighted that the 29-year-old was the ideal captain and provided plenty of support.

Pellistri replied: "The pleasure was mine to share and play with you! what a player and the most important thing, what a guy. Thank you for always being behind me and behind every player in this club, you are the definition of CAPTAIN!"

In addition to Pellistri, United have boosted their transfer pot through a number of summer sales. Alvaro Carreras completed a permanent move to Benfica following a loan spell, while Donny van de Beek, Willy Kambwala, Mason Greenwood and Aaron Wan-Bissaka have all moved on too, helping United recoup more than £50m in transfer fees.

More departures could yet follow with Napoli heavily interested in Scott McTominay and Christian Eriksen also attracting interest from Anderlecht. United are not done in terms of incomings either and hope to strike a deal with Paris Saint-Germain for Manuel Ugarte.
The latter, an international teammate of Pellistri also reacted to the winger's transfer. Ugarte posted a simple red heart in response to Pellistri's announcement he was departing Old Trafford.

headline: Man Utd can secure £500million windfall thanks to Sir Jim Ratcliffe decision
body: It looks increasingly likely Manchester United will eventually move into a new stadium under Sir Jim Ratcliffe's rule - which offers significant financial opportunity
Manchester United could rake in half a billion pounds by selling the naming rights to their proposed new stadium, it's been claimed.

Sir Jim Ratcliffe made no secret of his desire to give the Red Devils a state-of-the-art stadium following his minority takeover. Old Trafford has fallen well behind the standards expected of one of Europe's giants.

Ratcliffe wasted no time in getting to work on the matter, establishing a task force to determine the best path forward. Their conclusion announced last month favoured a new build to hold 100,000 fans on the club-owned land next to the Theatre of Dreams.
It's been suggested both can co-exist, with United keeping Old Trafford as a secondary venue. It's the more expensive option, coming with an estimated cost of £2billion.

But Dr Rob Wilson, a professor of Applied Sports Finance Sheffield Hallam University, has suggested a quarter of that could be recouped just through naming rights. "Old Trafford would still be called Old Trafford and then the big stadium next door would be called the Snapdragon Arena or something along those lines so you don't have that misalignment anymore," he told Casasdeapuestas.bet, discussing the possibility of United's kit sponsor extending their partnership.

"I think in terms of figures, if it was Snapdragon, they'd look to try and tie that into their shirt sponsorship and some of their other activities. It could do one or two things that could suppress the value because Snapdragon put another 30 on top of their £70million shirt sponsor to make it a round number.

"I think the stadium naming rights could be worth probably £50m a year in their own right. So if other companies get involved in that, then you've got a misalignment of brand. So Snapdragon might say that they need that and we'll do a £150m deal for shirt and stadium naming rights.
"You could see it go up a little bit higher but somewhere in the region of about £50m per season, they'd want something long-term. So that's £500m over 10 years."

Wilson highlighted how changing an iconic stadium name, as Barcelona have done with the Spotify Camp Nou, can lead to backlash. But if United follow their rivals, like Man City's Etihad home and Arsenal's Emirates ground, they can avoid any such issue.
Dr Wilson believes Snapdragon in particular could be a smart choice of partner. The company, a subsidiary of US tech firm Qualcomm, offers long-term security, much like Etihad and Emirates do.

He added: "What's really clever about what United are currently doing is that Snapdragon are about to go on the next wave of their journey, which is all tied up in tech, which means that it has longevity as a brand in the same way that Arsenal with Emirates and Manchester City with Etihad went for emergent Middle Eastern airlines that have got these big growth trajectories."

headline: What Ben Chilwell has said about his ties to Man Utd as Chelsea look to sell
body: Left-back Ben Chillwell looks set to join Chelsea's summer exodus, and he's spoken in the past about his connection to Manchester United, who have been offered his services
Chelsea castaway Ben Chilwell previously revealed he loved going to Manchester United games as a kid – and he could yet end up at Old Trafford as a player.

The 27-year-old is another to have fallen victim to the Blues' chaotic recruitment drive this summer. He and a range of others, including the publicly ousted Raheem Sterling, have essentially been told to seek pastures new.

Chilwell joined Chelsea in 2020 for a hefty £50million from Leicester City. But the injury-plagued England ace has failed to stake a claim to the first-choice left-back spot, being replaced by Marc Cucurella, who enjoyed a stellar Euro 2024 with Spain.

Erik ten Hag's United have emerged as a potential landing spot. And if his past comments – that it was the Red Devils who helped him fall in love with football – are anything to go by, then it's a transfer he would welcome.
"I used to go to Man United games, funnily enough, with my dad, who supported them," Chillwell told Chelsea's official website back in June 2023.

"The first one, I can’t remember who it was against, but it was a Man United game. We always used to go to the Champions League ones after school, so it would have been a Champions League game at Old Trafford. That’s the first one I remember. Having your first one in the Champions League is pretty good.

"We used to go by train, we would have to take about four different trains straight from school, and just about make it for kick-off, then get about four different trains on the way home as well, get home for one o’clock in the morning, straight into school the next morning again, but they were brilliant memories."

Chilwell joined Leicester at 12, working his way up to make his first-team debut under Claudio Ranieri in 2015. During the club’s miraculous league title success, he spent time at Huddersfield Town on loan and with the Foxes’ academy side.

He did feature in a two-legged loss to Tottenham in the FA Cup that year, which earned him endless plaudits for a composed performance. On the back of this showing, he penned a new five-year deal and was handed a league debut later in 2016.

He made 100 appearances in the Midlands before Chelsea snapped him up in 2020, where he has since won the Champions League. It wasn't the Foxes, however, that first ignited Chilwell’s love for the game – that accolade goes to the Red Devils.

"It’s nights like that [ watching United] which make you fall in love with football," Chilwell continued. "Going straight from school, six- or seven-hour round trip, just to go and watch a game. Just being starstruck and in awe of all the players, that’s the kind of night which makes you love football, I guess.

"I was focused all on the pitch, trying to find my favourite players at the time and just seeing them in person was crazy. Just the feeling of awe at the position they were in and looking up to them like gods. Of course, the atmosphere’s amazing, but I was definitely one of those people focused on the pitch and the players."

Ten Hag's team only hold reported interest in Chilwell currently. But, with the player on Chelsea's transfer list and United's first-choice left-back Luke Shaw currently sidelined again along with Tyrell Malacia, it could be a move to keep an eye on.

headline: Dimitar Berbatov tips young Man Utd star to win 'sensitive and delicate' fight
body: Former Manchester United striker Dimitar Berbatov is hoping for big things from Amad this season, with the winger looking to establish himself in the first-team at Old Trafford
Dimitar Berbatov believes Amad is "ready to make the difference" for Manchester United this season.

The 22-year-old joined United from Atalanta in 2020 and spent time on loan with Rangers and Sunderland before enjoying regular game-time for the Red Devils last season following his recovery from a knee injury.

Amad notably went on to score an extra-time winner in United's dramatic FA Cup quarter-final victory over Liverpool and, speaking ahead of the new season, he revealed Erik ten Hag had promised he would get his chance to impress this term.

Despite facing competition out wide from the likes of Marcus Rashford, Alejandro Garnacho, Antony and Jadon Sancho, Amad has started United's first two games of the season - and Berbatov believes the youngster is set for a big 12 months.

"Amad is still very, very young with a lot of football to play," the former United striker told Futbin.com. "I think it was beneficial for him to go on loan to Sunderland because you could see he wasn't ready to face and play regularly in the Manchester United first team.
"Now there's an improvement and growth in the way that he plays football. I think Ten Hag said that Amad is now ready to make the difference and to play more but the competition is going to be high.

‌"It's a sensitive and delicate situation when you're faced with competition and you're fighting for one place with four other players fighting for it. You need concentration on the training pitch, concentration during the games and whilst you prepare for games."
While Amad has been featuring on the wing for United, Berbatov feels that his versatility could prove useful for Ten Hag and huis former club in the coming months.

He continued: "Don't be discouraged when you're not playing. Sometimes football can be cruel but stay fighting, do your best in training and I think he'll get chances to play this season. He has to seize them but not only on the right.

‌"Sometimes he might have to play on the left or as a number ten. Maybe the coach needs you there and you'll find out something about yourself you didn't know existed. Maybe you can play in different positions. It'll be interesting to see how Ten Hag manages the luxury of options that he has."

headline: Man Utd swap Jadon Sancho for Raheem Sterling as Antony exits - Chelsea ace's transfer dream
body: A dream transfer scenario could see Chelsea and Manchester United conduct some major business that sees Raheem Sterling and Jadon Sancho swap clubs before the transfer window closes
The Chelsea nightmare of Raheem Sterling could lead to the fulfilment of a childhood dream - if he joins Manchester United in the coming days.
The England international is currently training away from Enzo Maresca's first-team squad with no future at the club after Chelsea offered him to Aston Villa.

Sterling is yet to have potential suitors come forward with offers but a dream scenario could see him join United with Jadon Sancho - who has struggled to strike a rapport with boss Erik ten Hag - moving in the opposite direction amid rumours Chelsea are interested in a deal.

Sterling, 29, has been stunned to find himself on the outskirts in west London, while Sancho's fallout with Ten Hag last season was well-documented. And there's evidence to suggest the ex- Manchester City star Sterling would be in favour of a move to the red half of the city - though there is no suggestion of interest at present.

"I shouldn't really say this - not now, definitely not now! - but when I was young I was a massive United fan," he told The Mirror in 2019. "I had an old United kit, from when they won the last FA Cup. I was at the final in 2007."

Sterling has seemingly been written off by Maresca just as the new campaign gets underway, with a wave of new arrivals creating even greater competition at Chelsea. The Blues had plenty of wide options including Cole Palmer, Mykhailo Mudryk, Noni Madueke and Christopher Nkunku but the arrivals of Pedro Neto and Joao Felix have intensified the battle all the more.

Having fallen victim to competition for places, Sterling will no doubt want a greater role in the next team he joins. So, a swap deal with Sancho would be a dreamy scenario given it could see him join the club he supported as a kid while also seeing a potential rival for minutes leave.

Sterling's chances of starting would be further aided if the Red Devils were to also part ways with Antony, who has failed to set the world alight in England. Ten Hag pushed to sign his former Ajax charge in the summer of 2022, but a dismal return of 11 goals and five assists in 82 games for United has seen his stock plummet.

The Brazil international has been linked with a move away on loan this summer, but finding a club willing to stump up even half of his £200,000-a-week wages may prove difficult. Sancho  , who was loaned to Borussia Dortmund last winter, is  more likely to leave this summer but United would still be left with solid options if Sterling signed and Antony also departed.
In that scenario, United would have Alejandro Garnacho, Marcus Rashford, Sterling and Amad to choose from in their wide positions.

Antony's agent, meanwhile, told journalist Fabrizio Romano earlier this summer that the Brazilian has no intentions of leaving. He said: "I see reports about a potential exit on loan. Antony’s plan is clear: Manchester United. He wants to stay, he’s only focused on Man United. We already spoke about that with the club."
It may also help a potential swap deal along that Sancho has confessed to being a Blues supporter in the past. And he once named two Chelsea icons as some of his heroes growing up.

"I’d probably say Frank Lampard," he told talkSPORT in 2021 when asked which players inspired him as a youth. "I was a Chelsea fan growing up, I can’t lie. Didier Drogba and Frank Lampard were my favourite players at the time."

headline: LiveTransfer news LIVE: Ugarte agent in Manchester, Liverpool deal done, Arsenal near £30m move, Trippier exit
body: Ilkay Gundogan is to complete his medical ahead of a return to Manchester City as Man Utd continue their efforts to sign Manuel Ugarte and Arsenal look to seal the transfer of Mikel Merino
Barely a week remains of the summer transfer window and activity is heating up in the Premier League.

Ilkay Gundogan is set for an incredible return to Manchester City to bolster Pep Guardiola's ranks too. The Barcelona star arrived in the United Kingdom earlier this week and the veteran is to complete his medical on Thursday.

That might not be the only blockbuster move on the horizon, with Manchester United and Arsenal looking to secure deals for Manuel Ugarte and Mikel Merino respectively. The Red Devils have now offered a loan deal to PSG with an agreement said to have been reached that will see the move completed one way or another.

The Gunners are expected to finally sign Real Sociedad star Merino too, while reports in Italy claim a late bid for Ademola Lookman is on the cards. Arsenal striker Eddie Nketiah could also make a £30million move to Nottingham Forest before the window shuts.

Liverpool still have work to do in both directions. They failed in landing Martin Zubimendi but could do a deal for the future by signing a new goalkeeper. A deal in principle is said to have been agreed with Brentford for Sepp van den Berg too, while Bobby Clark has completed his move to Red Bull Salzburg.

Elsewhere, Fulham completed their long-awaited move for Sander Berge on Thursday morning, with the Norwegian joining ex-Arsenal star Emile Smith Rowe in North London. Newcastle could also be busy towards the end of the window as they seek defensive reinforcements, with Kieran Trippier potentially making way.
Follow all the latest from those deals - and lots more - on the Mirror Football live transfer blog below...
Mohamed Simakan is on Liverpool's shopping list, according to Sky Deutschland.
The France Under-21 defender, currently at RB Leipzig is also on the radar of Juventus.
Liverpool are still waiting to confirm their first signing of the Arne Slot era, but the sale of Sepp van den Berg could pave the way for Simakan to arrive.
Clubs in the EFL and Scotland want to sign Nectarios Triantis on loan.
The Sunderland defender, 21, spent the second half of last season on loan at Hibernian in the Scottish Premiership before returning to the Stadium of Light for pre-season.
And the Australia Under-23 international is one player who could be given the green light to head out before next week's transfer deadline.
Crystal Palace and Leicester City have agreed an £8m fee for Jordan Ayew, according to South London Press.
Ghana striker Ayew is in the final year of his Palace contract, and came on as a substitute in the Eagles' Premier League opener.
Leicester are after attacking reinforcements after Kelechi Iheanacho left for Sevilla and Patson Daka sustained an injury on the eve of the season.
Manchester United are edging closer to landing top midfield target Manuel Ugarte from Paris St Germain.
United have been pursuing Ugarte all summer and Erik ten Hag wants the Uruguay star to partner Kobbie Mainoo in his midfield.
The club are speaking to Ugarte’s agent Jorge Mendes in Manchester and it is understood personal terms and contract length will not be issues.
United have struggled to agree a deal with PSG and the Ligue 1 giants value Ugarte at the £51million they paid Sporting Lisbon for him 13 months ago.
The Old Trafford club do not want to pay this up front, having spent nearly £150million this summer, and it is understood the idea of a loan with an obligation to buy next summer has been floated.
Ugarte, 23, is desperate to join United and this is undermining PSG’s attempts to play hardball in the negotiations.

Ugarte was not involved in PSG’s opening night win at Le Havre on Friday and it increasingly looks like the South American will get his desired move to Old Trafford to become United’s fifth summer signing.
Harvey Blair will join Portsmouth from Liverpool for around £300,000, according to The Athletic.
The 20-year-old has played just once for the Reds' first team, in a League Cup win against Preston in 2021,
Blair made a handful of appearances for Liverpool's Under-21s in Premier League 2 last term, most recently in a defeat against Sunderland.
Watford star Yaser Asprilla could yet play Champions League football this season, with The Athletic reporting that Grona are in advance talks over the player.
Colombia international Asprilla, 20, is expected to fetch a fee in the region of £25m, with Sky Sports now suggesting he's set for a medical this week.
Girona, who finished third in La Liga last season, have already raided the Premier League for Donny van de Beek and loan signing Bryan Gil this summer.
Brentford are wary of Bayer Leverkusen hijacking their move for Sepp van den Berg, according to the BBC.
The Bees have reached an agreement with Liverpool for the defender, who spent last season on loan in the Bundesliga with Mainz.
However, Leverkusen remain in the mix as they prepare for a return to the Champions Leaguel.
Maxi Oyedele has said his goodbyes in a social media post as he prepares to leave Manchester United for Legia Warsaw.
"My time at Manchester United has finally come to end. I want to say thank you to the only club I’ve ever known," the youngster wrote.
"Honoured to say I’ve been at the club for 12 years and had some unbelievable experiences with some amazing teammates.

"Thank you to all the coaches, staff and the fans, I will never forget the memories I have made at this club. I wish everyone at Manchester United all the best as I leave ready to start the next chapter of my career.
"This club will always be my home and once again thank you.
"Once a red, always a red."
A post shared by @maxioyedele
Manchester United defender Will Fish is set for a Cardiff City medical ahead of a permanent move, according to BBC Sport Wales.
The centre-back is set to move for a reported £2m, replacing Mark McGuinness after the Irishman's move to Luton.
Fish, 21, spent the last two seasons on loan at Scottish side Hibernian.
Celtic are keen to bring Sheffield United defender Auston Trusty to Parkhead, according to the Scottish Sun.
The United States international moved to Bramall Lane only a year ago, following a spell at Arsenal.
Trusty, 26, played 32 times in the Premier League last term as the Blades were relegated.
Netherlands goalkeeper Justin Bijlow is a target for Southampton, according to Sky Sports.
Talks have begun over the Feyenoord stopper, while Brighton keeper Jason Steele is another option.
Southampton have also been linked with Arsenal's Aaron Ramsdale, though Wolves appear to be front-runners there.
Fulham's offer accepted for Lyon attacking midfielder Rayan Cherki has been accepted according to the Athletic. The west London side made a proposal worth an initial £12million, with further add-ons.
Cherki continues to consider his option so more work to be done yet however.

"We've been linked with a lot of players in the summer, a lot of them are miles away and I've never heard of some of them.
"Some of them have been one chat in the building or a few videos I've watched.
"Left wing is not somewhere we're too light on numbers, we've got Ben Brereton-Diaz there, Sam Edozie plays there, we have other guys who can operate there.

"I wouldn't say it's high on the priority list right now, he's a very good player, his agent is a good friend of mine and he would know as I would if it was anywhere near to being done or we were really in that race. At this moment, we are not."

As Mirror Football revealed last night, Jude Soonsup-Bell is set to join Segunda outfit Cordoba on a permanent deal.
The Tottenham Hotspur forward, 20, will pen a three-year contract once the formalities of his switch to Spain are concluded.
Spurs, who snapped Soonsup-Bell up from Chelsea back in 2023, have negotiated a significant sell-on clause in to the deal and stand to benefit from any future sale.

headline: Sir Jim Ratcliffe's 'stance' on Ruud van Nistelrooy becoming Man Utd manager
body: Rene Meulensteen says the idea of Ruud van Nistelrooy replacing Erik ten Hag cannot be discounted if Manchester United endure a poor run of results in the Premier League
Sir Jim Ratcliffe would consider replacing Erik ten Hag with Ruud van Nistelrooy if Manchester United make a poor start to the season.

That’s according to former Red Devils first-team coach Rene Meulensteen, who was surprised to see the former United goal machine return to Old Trafford as a coach rather than take a management job elsewhere. After a torrid 2023/24 campaign – albeit one which ended with FA Cup glory – United got up and running in the Premier League with a 1-0 win over Fulham thanks to summer signing Joshua Zirkee’s late winner.

It is imperative for Ten Hag that United improve on last season’s dismal eighth-place finish. A slow start would see question marks over his future resurface, despite the fact that the Dutchman penned a new contract in the summer. It has been speculated that Van Nistelrooy, who has previously managed PSV Eindhoven, would be the first cab on the rank if Ten Hag is dispensed with.
Meulensteen, who worked under Sir Alex Ferguson between 2007 and 2013, will not be concerned but insists the prospect of co-owner Ratcliffe replacing Ten Hag with his countryman cannot be discounted.
“I don’t think Erik ten Hag will be worried about Rudd van Nistelrooy potentially replacing him, he’s too focused on the job at hand,” Meulensteen told Gambling Zone.

“But who knows what the future will bring. If United stutter at the start of the season and the results don’t go their way, Sir Jim Ratcliffe would consider Van Nistelrooy, but at the moment they believe that Erik is the right man and now we need to see what happens.

“It is an interesting development, what has happened at Manchester United because Ten Hag brought in his trusted staff and many of them have gone. Now he has brought in his friend Rene Hake, who was manager of Utrecht, as well as Van Nistelrooy, so he has identified what he needs.”

Meulensteen believes that Van Nistelrooy will inevitably return to management one day. He added: “I've stayed in touch with him and he's obviously keen to carry on in management and I thought that's what he's going to do.

“I thought he may have gone to manage in Spain and then the Burnley rumours came up. I thought he would’ve continued as a manager so I was surprised when he joined United because I can see Ruud as a manager.

“I think he's had a taste of it and I think he wants more of it. Why has he chosen to go with Erik ten Hag? Probably the fact that there's a chance for him to go back to Manchester United where he had some fantastic years and great memories.
“He will be a good influence and a strong influence in the dressing room. People will respect him and I think he’s got a lot to teach all those young forwards.”

headline: Cristiano Ronaldo encouraged to make 'romantic' career move by ex-Man Utd coach
body: Cristiano Ronaldo made an enchanting return to Manchester United in 2021, and has been urged to make a similar move by one of Sir Alex Ferguson's old coaches
Cristiano Ronaldo should make a romantic return to Europe to retire once his time in Saudi Arabia comes to an end.

That's the opinion of ex-Manchester United coach Rene Meulensteen, who sees a homecoming as the ideal way to end the illustrious career of the great Portuguese forward he once coached at Old Trafford.
Ronaldo switched to Al Nassr in 2023 after his bitter United reunion, and has committed to another season in Saudi Arabia this campaign after notching a record 35 league goals in his debut year.

After this, however, the icon's future is relatively unknown. Despite being 39 years old, he hasn't yet dropped any hints of retirement, his participation in the 2026 World Cup, or a move to any other club. Meulensteen feels as though calling it quits in the Middle East isn't fitting, and Ronaldo should return to Europe for a fairytale ending.
"There would be some romance in Cristiano Ronaldo returning to Europe to finish his career off," Meulensteen told Gambling Zone when discussing the Portuguese.

"But, one of the problems we saw with Portugal is that the focus becomes all about Ronaldo. It was all too focused on him which didn’t help, even though Ronaldo can still do a job as long as he understands his role and what he can contribute.
"He also needs to understand that he’s not the same player anymore, not the same as Cristiano Ronaldo when he was 28. He can still play an important role in many aspects.
"So yeah, I think it would be nice for a lot of reasons if he returned to Europe, maybe with Sporting. It will be really interesting to see when eventually he announces his retirement from football."
Ronaldo began his playing career with Sporting CP in 2002, making his first-team debut in the Champions League against Inter Milan. A year later, he was United bound.

Meulensteen began working with Ronaldo in 2007 when the Dutchman became a first-team coach under Ferguson. The superstar won his first Ballon d'Or a year later and left for Real Madrid for a then-world record £80million.

His time with Los Blancos saw him develop into one of the greatest players of a generation, if not all-time. He scored 451 goals in 438 games and led the team to four Champions League titles and two La Liga crowns.

His subsequent three-year spell with Juventus in 2018 and the Red Devils return in 2021 were not as successful as the sky-high standards set in Spain, and Ronaldo is now the relative face of the Saudi Pro League.
The superstar will turn 40 next year, and Meulensteen believes a return to his boyhood Sporting perhaps, which has been mooted in the past, could offer Ronaldo an ideal road to retirement.

headline: Sir Alex Ferguson’s true colours were seen by Sven-Goran Eriksson after blazing row
body: Sven-Goran Eriksson has recalled a clash with Sir Alex Ferguson ahead of the 2006 World Cup over the at-the-time England boss's decision to include Wayne Rooney in his squad
Sven-Goran Eriksson has opened up about his tumultuous relationship with Sir Alex Ferguson - and one fierce clash in particular over Wayne Rooney.

The 76-year-old Swede, who is bravely facing the final stages of terminal cancer, shared insights into one time in particular that he didn't see eye to eye with the former Manchester United manager in a new Amazon documentary titled 'Sven'. Eriksson is most renowned for his tenure as England manager from 2001 to 2006, during which he guided the Three Lions to two World Cups and a European Championship quarter-final.

He worked with the 'golden generation' of English talent including Michael Owen, David Beckham, Ashley Cole, Frank Lampard, Steven Gerrard and Paul Scholes, not forgetting a young Wayne Rooney. And it was Rooney's inclusion in the 2006 World Cup squad that sparked a clash with Ferguson.

Rooney was a doubt for the tournament after breaking his metatarsal while playing for Manchester United in a 3-0 defeat against Chelsea in April that year. Despite this, Eriksson was keen for the then-20-year-old striker to play a significant role in his World Cup plans, even arranging for an England doctor to assess Rooney's fitness ahead of the tournament.

This decision did not sit well with Ferguson, arguably the Red Devils' greatest-ever manager. In his new Amazon Prime documentary, 'Sven', Goran-Eriksson reminisced: "I said to the players 'I can't see any team which is stronger than us'. The problem was Rooney of course. Rooney, as always, doesn't know where to stop - so I think he created that injury a little bit by himself.

"I had a lot of phonecalls from Sir Alex - strange man when you touch Manchester United in a way he doesn't like, he stops to be a gentleman," Sven said with a grin, adding: "He [Rooney] was desperate to play, and whatever you asked him; 'no problem, no problem, no problem'. Maybe he shouldn't have been picked."

David Dein, former Football Association vice-chairman, later claimed it was the only time he ever saw Sven annoyed. In his book, 'Calling the Shots: How to Win in Football and Life' shared in the Daily Mail, he wrote: "The only time I ever saw Sven annoyed was when Sir Alex Ferguson called him at our World Cup base in 2006.

"Fergie was furious that Wayne Rooney was going to play at the World Cup, with England gambling on his recovery from a broken metatarsal. 'You're finished,' he screamed. Sven lost it. 'F*** off,' he said. 'Alex, I will pick Rooney. Have a nice holiday. Ciao, bye'."

Rooney didn't make his 2006 World Cup debut until England's second Group B match against Trinidad and Tobago, replacing Owen in the 58th minute. Despite featuring in every subsequent game, his only goal was a penalty during the nail-biting quarter-final shootout with Portugal, which led to England's departure from the tournament.

Following England's World Cup exit, Sven said goodbye to his role as England manager, making way for Steve McClaren. The Swedish coach went on to take the reins at Manchester City, Mexico, Leicester, Shanghai SIPG, Shenzen and the Philippines before hanging up his managerial boots in 2019.

headline: Chelsea transfer news: Enzo Maresca fires Raheem Sterling warning amid Man Utd 'offer'
body: Chelsea have a number of difficult decisions to make heading into the final fortnight of the summer transfer window with rumours over the futures of Raheem Sterling, Ben Chilwell and Romelu Lukaku
It would be a huge understatement to say that Chelsea have been busy in the transfer market.
Backed by American billionaire Todd Boehly, the Blues have not been afraid to splash the cash. A huge array of stars have arrived at Stamford Bridge this summer.

The latest to put pen to paper has been Joao Felix, who returns to Chelsea on a permanent deal from Atletico Madrid. Blues academy star Conor Gallagher has moved in the opposite direction as part of the deal.
Chelsea might not be done there either, with a whole host of stars linked with moves away. Take a look at all of the rumours coming out of Stamford Bridge over the past 24 hours:

Enzo Maresca has told Raheem Sterling in no uncertain terms that he faces little future at Chelsea. Speaking in a press conference, the Chelsea boss said: "I'm not saying Raheem is not a good player but I prefer different kinds of wingers. This is the reason why."

Sterling’s future already looks uncertain. The winger was left out of Maresca’s matchday squad against his former side Manchester City at the weekend, with his representatives demanding clarity in a strong statement.

Sterling has also seen his squad number taken away from him. Chelsea announced on Wednesday that summer signing Pedro Neto will wear the number 7 shirt - previously owned by Sterling - for the coming campaign.
Sterling, 29, was signed from Man City two years ago for £49.5m. He still has three years remaining on his contract with an option for a further campaign.
Another player who could leave before the end of the transfer window is Ben Chilwell. The England left-back has been told to look elsewhere for his football.
And it appears that Old Trafford could potentially be an option. According to talkSPORT, Manchester United have been offered the chance to sign Chilwell.

The Red Devils are currently struggling with injury issues at left-back, with Tyrell Malacia and Luke Shaw sidelined. Chilwell, signed from Leicester, has three years remaining on his contract with Chelsea.

While Sterling and Chilwell look set to leave in the coming weeks, another star who could be sold is Belgian frontman Romelu Lukaku. The striker has spent the last two seasons on loan with Inter Milan and Roma and could return to Italy.

According to Sky Sport Italia, Napoli director Giovanni Manna is set to fly into the UK to hold talks with Chelsea. The Serie A outfit previously lodged a bid of €30m (£25.5m). Lukaku would move to Naples initially on loan before completing a permanent move.
Napoli are also attempting to sign ex-Chelsea man Billy Gilmour from Brighton, and also Manchester United’s Scott McTominay.

headline: Man Utd transfer news: Erik ten Hag makes midfield decision as exodus begins
body: Erik ten Hag's defensive overhaul may not yet have reached its conclusion while Manchester United's midfield exodus begins entering the final week of a busy summer transfer window

Manchester United have spent big on a defensive overhaul this season but they could still make another major addition before the window closes next week with talk of a deal for Everton star Jarrad Branthwaite resurfacing.
Yet head coach Erik ten Hag must also trim his squad with the departure of Facundo Pellistri the first exit of several anticipated over the coming days.
Meanwhile, one man who looks destined to remain is Brazilian midfielder Casemiro after he convinced Ten Hag of his value during pre-season.
Here are the big tales from Old Trafford ove the past 24 hours.
Manchester United are clearing out some of their fringe players with Facundo Pellistri joining Panathinaikos for £5.1million.

The deal for Pellistri is close and United will have a 40 per cent sell-in clause inserted in the transfer. Pellistri, 22, had loan spells in Spain at Alaves and Granada and the Uruguay midfielder made four starts for United.

He also came on in the Community Shield defeat on penalties to Manchester City and United are letting him go because he wants regular senior football. Boss Erik ten Hag wants another midfielder to partner Kobbie Mainoo in the holding role in his 4-2-3-1 formation and he does not see Pellistri getting much game time.

Tunisia midfielder Hannibal Mejbri is also set to leave Old Trafford and Burnley and Leeds are battling it out for him. B urnley want a midfielder to replace the Fulham-bound Sander Berge and feel Mejbri can help.
Casemiro has seemingly earned a reprieve at Manchester United after impressing Erik ten Hag during pre-season.

The Brazilian midfielder, 32, impressed initially after joining the Red Devils in the summer of 2022 but there had been speculation he would be sold in the summer transfer window after a disappointing 2023/24 campaign.
Saudi Arabia was touted as a potential destination for the former Real Madrid star, who is thought to be among United's top earners - but a new report claims Casemiro will stay.
It was reported that the relationship between Ten Hag and Casemiro broke down last season after alleging the veteran was overweight and unfit at the start of last year's campaign.
But now he is back in the first-team plans.
Manchester United have not given up on signing Jarrad Branthwaite despite signing Matthijs de Ligt and Leny Yoro.

The Red Devils have spent more than £100million reinforcing their defensive options after seeing multiple bids turned down for the Everton star. There is however an admission that the move won't come before the end of the month.

Branthwaite remains on United's radar ahead of a prospective move in 12 months time. The club offered as much as £50m before completing a £58.9m deal with Lille for Yoro and more recently landing De Ligt for £42.8m.
The 22-year-old defender is said to have drawn interest from Manchester City and Liverpool this summer. Everton have made it clear they no intention of selling Branthwaite to Liverpool however.
And United still appear to be keen.

headline: Man Utd let swap deal fall through fingers as £25m transfer could hand Manuel Ugarte boost
body: Manchester United have been pursuing a move for Paris Saint-Germain midfielder Manuel Ugarte all summer, and could snap him up using the money made from selling Hannibal Mejbri
Sander Berge's £25million move to Fulham could boost Manchester United's chances of signing Manuel Ugarte - if they sell Hannibal Mejbri first.

United have been aiming to sign a midfielder all summer, looking at Paris Saint-Germain's Ugarte and Burnley's Sander Berge. With the Clarets now eyeing Hannibal, it looks like United could have fashioned a swap deal with the side if they had pushed for Berge.

However, Ugarte has always been the main target and United have now watched Fulham agree to a £20m-plus deal for Berge, according to The Athletic. However, United could still make a deal work with Burnley as they are still interested in signing Hannibal.
The 21-year-old is entering the final year of his contract and the Championship side are keen to sign him, even if it is just a season-long loan.
United would prefer a permanent transfer, with the midfielder failing to become a regular face in the first team, after enduring a tough loan spell at Sevilla last season.
Burnley could utilise the £25m received for Berge to sign Hannibal, which could boost United's finances and enable them to sign Ugarte - who has reportedly agreed terms with the Premier League side.
United were originally unwilling to match PSG's asking price of £51.1m for the Uruguay international, and also planned to sell Scott McTominay to Napoli to fund the transfer.
The £25m asking price for McTominay may have put off Napoli, as they are also looking at Brighton's Billy Gilmour - but the sale of another midfielder could set the ball rolling for United.
Erik ten Hag may also be interested in opting for a loan deal for Ugarte, with an obligation to buy - but fans will be waiting in anticipation to see what happens for the rest of the transfer window.

headline: Man Utd star opens up on bold Erik ten Hag call after Sir Alex Ferguson favourite departs
body: Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag chose to reshuffle his backroom staff at Old Trafford after being allowed to stay by Sir Jim Ratcliffe and a Red Devils star has spoken out on the changes
Manchester United star Tom Heaton has spoken out on Erik ten Hag ’s summer staff changes - and has been left impressed.

The Dutchman found himself under pressure at Old Trafford this summer but retained the faith of Sir Jim Ratcliffe. Immediately after that decision was made, Ten Hag started to make sweeping changes behind the scenes.

Steve McCLaren and Benni McCarthy were two members of staff allowed to leave, with Ruud van Nistelrooy and Rene Hake among those to arrive. Long-term goalkeeping coach Richard Hartis also departed to be replaced by Jelle ten Rouwelaar.
Heaton has now opened up on the changes behind the scenes. While he was sad to see Sir Alex Ferguson ’s former colleague Hartis depart, he has been full of praise for Ten Rouwelaar’s work so far.

“Obviously the coaching staff that have gone out the building were all fantastic in their own right,” Heaton said to The Independent. “Richard Hartis, the goalkeeper coach, who I have a brilliant relationship with, known him for a long time, was superb.
“But the club and the manager decided to make a change, so Jelle’s come in with different ideas and I’m really enjoying working with him at the minute.
“A lot of thinking behind his training sessions, making the goalkeepers… really stressing their thinking and understanding the in-possession tactical stuff.

“It’s been really good so far. Real good guy, really enjoyed working with him, and that goes for the rest of the coaching staff that have come in. Ruud, I obviously played with when I was a kid, and Rene (Hake) and Andreas (Georgson). It’s sort of a fresh look.”

Ten Rouwelaar’s predecessor Hartis enjoyed two hugely successful spells at Old Trafford. He was initially at the club between 2001 and 2010, proving to be a pivotal member of staff under Alex Ferguson.

Speaking about his exit back in July, he said: “Manchester United is a special football club and it’s been wonderful to be part of it on two separate occasions over the past 24 years. I am proud to have had the opportunity to work with some very hard-working and committed people across all areas of the club, and to have experienced so many great moments with them along the way.

"In particular, I would like to thank all the goalkeepers, both past and present, who dedicated themselves to representing the club and playing in a way that befits Manchester United. I want to wish everyone at the club the very best for the future.”

headline: Ben Chilwell 'offered to Man Utd' with England star surplus to requirements at Chelsea
body: Ben Chilwell is among the squad members tipped to leave Chelsea before the end of the summer transfer window with the England international not part of Enzo Maresca's plans
Chelsea have offered Ben Chilwell to Manchester United as they aim to further trim their wage bill, it has been claimed.

England defender Chilwell joined Chelsea from Leicester City in 2020, playing more than 100 first-team games during an injury-hit four years in West London. The 27-year-old signed a contract extension towards the end of the 2022-23 season, with his current deal running until the summer of 2027.

Since signing that deal, though, two changes of manager have left him down the pecking order. Current boss Enzo Maresca has been brutally honest with the left-back, who barely featured in pre-season and has been told he will struggle for minutes without a move.

A transfer to Premier League rivals United is among the possibilities explored, though it's far from straightforward. Erik ten Hag's side are currently without injured duo Luke Shaw and Tyrell Malacia, which may explain Chelsea's approach.

According to talkSPORT, United have been offered the chance to sign Chilwell and Chelsea would not stand in the way of a move. He wasn't part of the squad chosen by Maresca to face Manchester City on Sunday, with Marc Cucurella starting at left-back.

"With Chilly it's quite clear," Maresca said in the lead-up to the Premier League opener. "I love the way he trains, I love the way he is but the problem is that he struggles with us a little bit to find his best position.

"When you train everyday and you don't get minutes, it's not good for them and it's not good for me because I need to make decisions. For some players, it's sometimes better to leave and to go somewhere to get minutes. We will see what happens, the transfer window is open and we will see what happens."

Chilwell is one of a number of senior stars left out of Maresca's squad to face Servette in Thursday's Europa Conference League play-off first leg. Raheem Sterling has also been omitted, with the former Manchester City star losing his squad number to summer signing Pedro Neto on Wednesday.
Sterling, like Chilwell, was left out of the matchday squad on Sunday. "I'm not saying Raheem is not a good player but I prefer different kinds of wingers. This is the reason why," the manager said.
Joao Felix will also play no part against Servette despite completing his move from Atletico Madrid. However, Maresca expressed his joy at landing the Portugal international.
"He can play inside, outside, he can play as a No.9 and this versatility is one of the reasons why we have signed him," Maresca said. "He’s a very good player and we are happy to have him here."

headline: Man Utd staff 'eating next to toilets' as Sir Jim Ratcliffe continues cost cutting
body: Sir Jim Ratcliffe has been embarking on a series of cost-cutting measures since he took partial ownership of Manchester United midway through the 2023-24 season
Workers at Manchester United's stadium have found themselves eating by toilet cubicles as part-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe continues to cut costs around the club's facilities, it has been claimed.

Since completing his partial takeover of the club during the 2023-24 season, British billionaire Ratcliffe has embarked on significant cost-cutting measures. These include trimming the workforce by nearly a quarter, with some 250 of 1,100 staff members at risk of losing their jobs.

The measures were brought into place following a review conducted early in the part-owner's reign, which uncovered a need for significant savings. Staff were told of impending redundancies in early July, with further cost-cutting measures anticipated at the time.

Efforts have been made to eradicate "non-essential" activities, while some measures introduced before Ratcliffe's arrival have remained in place. Now, however, reports have pointed to further changes - some of which may affect staff's eating patterns.
According to The Mail, workers have spoken of setting up a dining table next to toilet cubicles. However, United have indicated they have not been forced to eat in such an environment.

Rather, the space in question is understood to be a staff room with adjoining toilet facilities. It is thought to be quieter than the designated area for staff to eat, and is used for breaks rather than being a required eating area.

Staff also previously received a lunchbox from the club, but are now served food from the hot buffet which is also the source of food for some corporate guests. However, the club has indicated these meals are specially made, rather than being leftovers from the food provided to guests, while the lunchboxes were discontinued as a waste-cutting measure after the club found food was being left uneaten.

Avoiding waste is also understood to be the motivation behind providing half the attendees of corporate boxes with a programme. If any guest asks for a programme they are provided with one, while QR codes linking to digital copies are also available, but the numbers provided from the get-go come after a review found many were not taken home by guests.

The latest news comes after reports emerged of efforts from Ratcliffe to uncover new money-making avenues. United have spent £150million on new signings this summer as they look to put last season's eighth-place finish behind them.

One such avenue is a potential documentary putting some of the recent upheaval into focus. Rivals Manchester City, Arsenal and Tottenham have all been subject to behind-the-scenes shows as part of the 'All or Nothing' franchise on Amazon Prime, with the Arsenal edition - released in 2022 - the most recent.

headline: Man Utd include important clause after confirming transfer exit for Ole Gunnar Solskjaer signing
body: Manchester United have considered their summer clearout in their first transfer window of the INEOS era, but the Premier League side have been preparing for the future
Facundo Pellistri's move from Manchester United to Panathanaikos comes with a pair of clauses which will allow the Premier League club to benefit if the winger hits the heights once predicted of him.

The Uruguay winger joined United from Penarol back in 2020 for £7.65million, and they had hoped to turn a profit. However, Panathanaikos are reported to have haggled down to £5.1m plus add-ons - less than what the selling club were after.

In exchange, though, United will benefit from a 45 percent sell-on fee, protecting them if his new club turn a significant profit. Not only that, but they also have a three-year buy-back clause after the 22-year-old signed a four-year contract in Greece.

United have followed the lead of Arsenal, who have inserted a "significant" clause in a deal which will take Charlie Patino to Deportivo La Coruna. The Gunners are expected to receive just £1m initially for the 20-year-old midfielder, but could be in for a windfall further down the line.

Pellistri initially joined United on a five-year deal in 2020. With that deal due to run out at the end of the current campaign, and with Erik ten Hag considering him surplus to requirements, they decided to cash in.

The winger had to wait more than two years for his senior debut for the club, despite playing for Uruguay at the 2022 World Cup. That first appearance eventually arrived in January 2023, after two loan spells in Spain with Alaves.

In a statement confirming Pellistri's departure, United pointed to his experience in Spain and his form for his country at the recent Copa America. "Everyone at the club would like to wish Facundo the very best of luck with his new club, and thank him for his efforts here," the statement concluded.

Pellistri made a total of 25 senior appearances for United, the msot recent of them in the Community Shield. He failed to score in any of those outings, but did bag his first goals in European football during a loan spell at Granada last term.

The winger is the sixth United player to leave for a fee this summer. In addition, the club have cleared the wage bill after the likes of Raphael Varane and Anthony Martial were allowed to leave when their contracts expired.

Alvaro Carreras was the first to depart, completing a permanent move to Benfica following a spell on loan last term. Donny van de Beek, Willy Kambwala, Mason Greenwood and Aaron Wan-Bissaka have also moved on, with United recouping more than £50m for the sextet.
More departures could still follow before the end of the window. Scott McTominay has attracted interest from Fulham and Napoli, while questions remain over Christian Eriksen's future.

headline: Man Utd at crucial stage in Manuel Ugarte talks as PSG double down on stance
body: Manuel Ugarte has emerged as Manchester United's top target for the final days of the summer transfer window, but the Red Devils are struggling to agree a deal with PSG
PSG are refusing to budge on their £51million valuation of Manuel Ugarte, with talks with Manchester United now at a crucial stage.

Ugarte only signed for the French giants last summer, but soon fell out of favour under boss Luis Enrique. They are ready to sanction an exit, with United currently the leading suitors having chased him all summer.

Red Devils boss Erik ten Hag is keen to bolster his options in midfielder and is thought to be a huge fan of Ugarte. The Uruguayan was not involved in PSG's opening game of the season against Le Harve due to the speculation around his future.

United have made an offer in the region of £42million for the 23-year-old, which is below PSG's asking price. And a new report suggests that with nine days left of the window, time is running out to find a compromise.

According to the Daily Mail, United have been offered Ugarte on a loan deal which contains an obligation tto buy clause worth £51m. That is too high for United though, who continue to value the midfielder at £9m less.

PSG remain happy to go ahead with the deal, but are understood to be unwilling to cut their valuation, which is the fee they paid to sign Ugarte from Sporting Lisbon last summer. Ugarte featured in 37 games in all competitions for PSG last season.

But he is unlikely to see that level of game-time this term, with Enrique preferring other options. United are still trying to sell Scott McTominay, with Ugarte a direct replacement for the Scotland international.
The impasse over Ugarte comes as Ten Hag made a U-turn on the future of Casemiro. It looked likely the veteran midfielder would be allowed to leave Old Trafford after a difficult second season.

But the 32-year-old has impressed in pre-season and fought his way back into Ten Hag's plans. Though the Saudi Pro League was seen as a potential destination for the Brazilian, he now looks set to remain at United.
Ten Hag and Casemiro have repaired their relationship after it broke down over the course of last year's disappointing campaign. In fact, Casemiro has started both of United's games so far this term.

That came in the Community Shield defeat to Manchester City and the win over Fulham. While Ugarte could still arrive before next Friday night's deadline, Ten Hag appears to be ensuring he is well-stocked in midfield.
Ugarte is unlikely to arrive before Saturday's trip to Brighton, meaning Casemiro should once again line up alongside Kobbie Mainoo in United's midfield pairing.

headline: Leeds United keen on forgotten Man Utd star who was involved in training ground fight
body: Erik ten Hag is willing to let rough-and-ready midfielder Hannibal Mejbri depart Old Trafford this summer, with a pair of Championship clubs lining up to sign him
Manchester United midfielder Hannibal Mejbri has been deemed surplus to requirements by Erik ten Hag this summer - with Leeds and Burnley interested.
The young Tunisian was signed by United in 2019, joining from Monaco in a deal worth roughly £9million, and first broke through into the first team under Ralf Rangnick.

Two loan spells later, Ten Hag is looking to offload the midfielder. Burnley are an interested party, as they need a replacement for Sander Berge, who is set to join Fulham. The Clarets are familiar with the 21-year-old, as Mejbri played against them September last year.

Leeds are another potential suitor. They have lost both Archie Gray and Glen Kamara in the middle of the park and need a tenacious tackler like Mejbri, who let his temper get the better of him in 2022 during a training group scuffle.

After a humbling 4-0 loss to Brighton, then-head coach Ralf Rangnick was forced to end a training session early after it was reported that Mejbri and teammate Alex Telles were involved in an altercation.

The two allegedly had to be pulled apart because the incident was so severe, but that didn't stop the young Tunisian from continuing to feature under Rangnick. Days later, he played in the club's final match of the season against Crystal Palace.

Telles was offloaded shortly after the incident, and Mejbri was in contention to feature regularly under then-incoming boss Ten Hag. However, he was instead sent on loan to Birmingham City for the 2022/23 season..
Last September, the Dutchman praised the youngster's progression since returning from his spell away but warned that on the back of consecutive Premier League starts, he must carry on improving.

“I think he gives a very good message to the rest of the squad that this is the demand," Ten Hag stated. "This has to be the standard when you are playing in a position, what you have to bring to the team, to get success.

"He is a good fit to contribute to a good performance and to the result. I don’t think [his adaptation has been] that quick. Before I came in here, he was already in the first team, he made his debut. He is making progress.
"So, that's why he deserved an opportunity, and I think he's taking that opportunity now. he did a great job for the team, he really contributed to our levels in the last two games.

"Every time he has to improve, and he has to give the evidence that he is worthy of playing. It's good that the internal competition is there, and hopefully, it will give other players a push that they have to bring more, and they have to add more."

Yet, the midfielder was loaned out to Sevilla in January, where a £17m but out clause wasn't triggered after he made just six appearances. It now looks like he'll leave Old Trafford permanently, with the Championship his likely destination.

headline: Dan Ashworth's Joao Pedro talks come to light as Man Utd told his £50m team-mate is class
body: Dan Ashworth is now pulling the strings at Manchester United and it appears he was told to sign one of Brighton and Hove Albion's best players
Ex-Brighton and Hove Albion star Glenn Murray revealed he once told Manchester United supremo Dan Ashworth to sign Joao Pedro.

Five years before he was installed as United sporting director, Ashworth was the technical director at the Amex Stadium. Over the last five years, Brighton have established themselves as one of the most financially savvy clubs in the Premier League and European football.

One of their signings last season was former Watford ace Pedro, who signed from the Hornets for the Seagulls for £30million. A matter of years before he moved to the South Coast side, Murray, who played alongside the Brazilian at the Hornets, recommended his ex-team-mate in private talks with Ashworth.

Ashworth never moved for him while he was at Brighton but rivalled his old club for Pedro's signature when he was at Newcastle United, which suggested he had listened to Murray's advice and taken a fancying of the player.

While speaking on Brighton and Hove Albion's official YouTube channel, Murray was talking about Pedro with Danny Welbeck after the latter heaped huge praise on the Brazilian. Murray said: "I must admit, when I played with you guys with Watford, he was the one that makes you go 'Wow, who is this kid?' The things he could do, he (Pedro) was so good.

"I think there’s a lot more growth in him, he has loads more to give. We’ve seen glimpses from last year of what he is capable of and his tally was impressive in the end. But, I think he can get so much better."

He also added: "I’ll be honest, he was my first call back to Dan Ashworth. I was literally getting on the train and I was like ‘You’ve got to sign this kid’. He was that type of player where you were just blown away by him."

Ashworth departed Brighton in February 2022, just under 18 months before Pedro arrived at Brighton. He would go on to spend close to two years at Newcastle, before departing the Magpies to take over as sporting director at Old Trafford this summer.

United have since been linked with a wide variety of players from Brighton. They are among the admirers of academy star Evan Ferguson, who hammered home 16 goals and five assists in his debut campaign.
However, injuries last season restricted him to just six goals in 27 appearances. While his stock has dwindled slightly, United have still regularly been linked with a £50m move for the Irishman.

Ex-United hitman Welbeck is still a huge admirer of the forward. The former England international, who has played with some of the best players in England over the course of his career, talked up the Irishman by branding him a 'predator in the box'.

Welbeck said: "Evan was unfortunate with injuries last season. It was one of them where once he gets his games this season, I’m pretty sure he will be just as lethal as he was when he came into the side.

"He’s a predator in the box and there’s not many like him around. He’s big and strong, but he’s agile and lethal in the box. I’m looking forward to seeing him back on the pitch and, obviously, we’ve got a lot of new players that have come into the side."

United have already to Rasmus Hojlund - who is currently injured - and Joshua Zirkzee as their strike options this season but they will no doubt have liked what their ex-striker Welbeck had to say about Ferguson as Erik ten Hag continues to weigh up a transfer move for him.

headline: Chelsea offer Raheem Sterling to Premier League rival as transfer stance made crystal clear
body: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca has made clear that Raheem Sterling has no future under him at Stamford Bridge but is intent on staying in the Premier League
Chelsea have offered Raheem Sterling to Aston Villa after Enzo Maresca made clear the England winger is not wanted at Stamford Bridge.
The £47.5m signing is among the 15 Blues players up for sale and banished to train away from the first team.

Sterling wants to stay in the Premier League - he has been offered to Unai Emery's men, who can offer Champions League football - and his desire to win back his England place rules out a move to Saudi Arabia. Juventus were interested in a player swap deal, involving Federico Chiesa, which would not suit Chelsea.

Sterling claimed he wanted “clarity” from the club after he was left out of the squad to face Manchester City in the Premier League opener. The former Liverpool winger is the highest earner at Stamford Bridge on £300,000-a-week while the average wage on longer, incentivised contracts is now only £60,000. And the five-time Premier League players need to sell players to balance the books.
But on the day Chelsea completed the £45.5m signing of Joao Felix, the Italian head coach claimed Sterling is being sold for footballing reasons.
"I'm not saying Raheem is not a good player but I prefer different kinds of wingers,” he said. “This is the reason why.

"I spoke with Raheem, one-on-one the day before City and I explained him exactly the situation. I didn't see Raheem after the game. "In this moment, they (Sterling and Ben Chilwell) are training apart. The situation with them both is quite clear. There is not any update on their situations."
“In case I sit with Raheem, I will tell him exactly the same things that I already told him. I don’t have anything new to tell him because I was quite clear.”
The Stamford Bridge club is now in a race against time to offload players before the August 31 transfer deadline - or risk needing to keep paying and playing the unwanted players.
"We'll see,” added the Italian. “Now it is a bit early. We still have 10 days of the transfer window. As I said many times, many things can happen in the last 10 days, the last week, so we'll see."

headline: Rasmus Hojlund and Joshua Zirkzee sent reality check over Man Utd roles
body: Manchester United signed Joshua Zirkzee this summer to provide an alternative option to Rasmus Hojlund up-front, with the Dutchman scoring the winner against Fulham on his debut
Rasmus Hojlund and Joshua Zirkzee have been warned they are in competition for a starting spot at Manchester United.
Hojlund arrived at Old Trafford last summer in a £72million deal from Atalanta. He enjoyed a positive debut season at United after a difficult start, ending with 16 goals in all competitions.

With the Dane having been their only recognised centre forward, boss Erik ten Hag opted to boost his options by bringing in Zirkzee from Bologna. He made the perfect start, scoring the winner on his debut to beat Fulham last Friday.
Hojlund is currently ruled out with injury and United icon Dimitar Berbatov has warned him he will need to hit the ground running when he does return if he wants to retake his place from Zirkzee.

"Hojlund's goal ratio must improve. He should be better and I think he can be better. He can do better but it comes down to concentration levels. So this is the moment where he has to work even harder which won't be easy but it’ll be beneficial," Berbatov told FUTBIN.

“It’s going to be a competition and because there's a lot of football to be played it’s good to have different options for different games and opponents. Sometimes you have to decide your team based on the opponents and the defenders of the team.

“Sometimes it’s difficult for the attackers to understand why they’ve been benched and why another attacker is playing ahead of him but this is the job of the manager. My wish is, especially with Rasmus having a year in the Premier League, for them to score goals as soon as possible. This is how strikers are judged.

"As a striker I also look out for so many other things. How they open up the pitch, the spaces they leave for their team mates, how they control the ball, dropping back to get on the ball and then getting up the pitch, following the game. For Zirkzee and Hojlund, the most important thing is scoring goals."

Boss Ten Hag has been delighted with the way Zirkzee has kicked off his United career. And the Dutchman has also revealed that the new signing will bring new attributes to his squad, which Hojlund does not possess.

"It is very good for a striker to come into Manchester United and to score the winning goal in his first game. We are very happy with him, it is very pleasing and we are very happy with him. It is also encouraging and it will give him courage and belief - and for the fans," he said.

"It is a very good start. He has some attributes we didn't have, straight away he showed that. He is very good in his linking up and combinations and we have some good ball-playing offensive players and they can take benefit from this.

"But that is what I wanted to say, he has to arrive in the box. He has to arrive in the box and score goals, he did and the winner is very pleasing for everyone. He has had an individual programme to build up his fitness and we then had to bring him into the team training."

headline: Roy Keane explains why Steven Gerrard's behaviour wouldn't have been accepted at Man Utd
body: Steven Gerrard and Xabi Alonso pushed hard to leave Liverpool during their playing days, and Roy Keane insists their antics wouldn't have been tolerated at Manchester United
Roy Keane says Steven Gerrard and Xabi Alonso's underhanded attempts to quit Liverpool wouldn't have been tolerated at Manchester United.

Gerrard very nearly swapped Liverpool for Chelsea in 2004 and again in 2005, and even submitted a transfer request to push for the move. He eventually rescinded the request and stayed at Anfield, though a very similar drama involving Reds team-mate Alonso, almost unfolded a few years later.

According to ex-Liverpool manager Rafa Benitez, Alonso refused to take part in a Champions League game at the start of the 2008/09 season because he was on the cusp of joining Arsenal and didn't want to be cup-tied. While discussing the saga, Keane insisted Gerrard and Alonso would have been ostracised if they'd pulled the same stunts as United players.

"Jamie [Carragher], you're a Liverpool lad. With Gerrard, sometimes a player wants to leave a club. But when they refuse to play or they don't want to be cup tied, I'm surprised players don't turn on them when they are gone," Keane said on the Stick To Football podcast, brought to you by Sky Bet.

"We wouldn't have tolerated that at United. [To Benitez] I know managers can have a disagreement with the player and the player wants to leave. It is straightforward for managers, to deal with a player who is not doing what he is supposed to be doing, when everyone is mates with him."
Like Gerrard's prospective Chelsea switch, Alonso's move to Arsenal never materialised. However, the Spaniard did eventually exit Anfield, joining Real Madrid in 2009.

Liverpool, during Benitez's era, often seemed like a launchpad for elite stars. Like Alonso, the likes of Javier Mascherano and Fernando Torres all left for clubs competing at the highest level, and Benitez has admitted his team "couldn't compete" with the wealthier teams around them.

Shedding light on Alonso's situation back in 2008, the ex-Valencia, Newcastle and Chelsea boss explained that Liverpool needed to generate funds, and were forced to consider selling their best players: "We needed to sell. Xabi had an agreement; he was talking with one club and had an agreement," Benitez said.

"We played Standard de Liege for a Champions League qualifier and we had Javier Mascherano and Lucas Leiva in the Olympic Games, Steven Gerrard had a lower back problem, so we had to play [Damien] Plessis and Xabi. Xabi had an agreement with Arsenal and didn’t want to get cup-tied.

"I told Jamie Carragher and Gerrard before the game that he had an agreement and doesn’t want to play, but he must because it is the most important game to qualify for the Champions League. Then when you were going out for the warm-ups, you said, ‘Poor Xabi.’ Not poor Xabi, he is playing for our club at this time. During the season he was our best player and didn’t go to Arsenal because he had to play [for us]."

Alonso was tipped earlier this year for a stunning return to Anfield as head coach when the Bayer Leverkusen boss emerged as a contender to take over from the departing Jurgen Klopp. However, the former Spain international chose to stay put, leading Liverpool to appoint Arne Slot instead.
